A Guide To Saucer Stone Pieces
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Items, Accessories, Foods: A Guide To Saucer Stone Pieces
By Lisa Shock on Thursday, October 25, 2001 - 08:36 pm:

The saucer stone pieces are items found on ventures, usually in "bad feeling" spots. Some monsters are great at finding them, and will find lots of them even at very young ages. Other monsters just don't seem to have what it takes. Stats don't appear to have much to do with discovery process, since babies with all stats under 150 have been known to find plenty of them. Higher ranking monsters seem to find high ranking pieces, like those for Zan.

The pieces have point values based on rarity, and can be traded with the opponents who visit your ranch.

Once you have 4 pieces of the same type, it doesn't matter where they are postioned in the view, you can go into town and talk to Grandpa Bragma about redeeming them. The completed stone can make a monster in your encyclopedia, if you don't already have it. The stones only make the "Main" type of each breed, that is the monster whose type name is the same as the whole breed. (Pixie/Takrama is named "Pixie", and is the type made by 4 pieces.) Check your encyclopedia carefully. If you already have the breed in your encyclopedia, Bragma will try to take your pieces, so check before going into town and selecting this option. Take those pieces and trade with opponents until you get a breed you need.

After a while, as your encyclopedia fills, you will no longer need to pay attention to managing the peices. They are simply a way to get monsters without using CDs.
